actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security, and Investigations.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security, and Investigations

official_title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to prohibit interference with communication frequencies used by emergency response providers.
short_title: Emergency Responder Radio Communications Protection Act of 2014

summary.text: Emergency Responder Radio Communications Protection Act of 2014 - Amends the federal criminal code to prohibit knowingly: (1) interfering with the working or use of any radio frequency used by emergency response providers; or (2) obstructing, hindering, or delaying the transmission of any communication over any such frequency.

titles.title: Emergency Responder Radio Communications Protection Act of 2014
To amend title 18, United States Code, to prohibit interference with communication frequencies used by emergency response providers.
